Definitely better than the first. The writing, as always, is very good. Still disappointed in the lack of cake but at least there was a very smart and amazing wheat man.
Good old Portal game. Better than first game in terms of graphics, length, puzzles. In my opinion worse in storyline. All in all very worth playing. It will run even on a potato ;)

This game was my introduction to Valve, and by extension the Source engine. I got the game in 2013 on my Dad's PS3 and I've been playing through the campaign at least once every year since. The game is amazing, an awesome balance of funny and serious. I strongly recommend anyone who has the money and time, buy this game. It won't dissapoint.

The Standard Engineer RIG is the most basic form of Resource Integration Gear available for engineers throughout the course of their employment. It closely resembles the Standard Astronaut RIG due to the fact that it is almost skin-tight and has a small projection system for holographic display.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Isaac's ID tag can be seen on the left of his chest while wearing the suit, but disappears when the RIG is upgraded.
From the beginning of the game, the suit appears to be badly worn and damaged. This pre-existing wear slowly disappears more and more as the suit is upgraded.
This suit only has 10 storage spaces, holding fewer supplies than any other suit.
The suit also made an appearance in the Previously on Dead Space feature for Dead Space 2, even appearing in the representation of Dead Space's ending.
Despite being put on like any normal helmet, the suit's helmet still forms an airtight seal, it could be speculated that it uses the same membrane system when the helmet is put on as the more advanced CEC Engineering Suit.
